intro: Glaucium refractocarpum subsp. refractocarpum, commonly known as the narrowleaf whitlow grass, is a member of the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lanceolate leaves that are often covered in a waxy, bluish coating. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow flowers with prominent, showy petals. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic study.
